intro: Clusia loranthacea, commonly known as the mistletoe plant, is a hemiparasitic shrub that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Salicaceae and is native to regions in South America, particularly Brazil. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in its often-dry habitat. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are pollinated by insects, followed by fleshy, berry-like fruits. Clusia loranthacea plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for birds and other animals.
